Authors: Kozue Sotome, T. Hsttori, Yuko Ota, Makoto Kakishima
Title:
Second report of Polyporus longiporus and its phylogenetic
position
Abstract:
Polyporus longiporus, belonging to group Polyporellus, is
newly reported from Japan what constitutes also the second report of the
species since its original description. This species is characterized by
radially elongated pores, smooth and brown to dark brown pileus and
cylindrical and slightly curved basidiospores. Phylogenetic analysis
based on the ITS region revealed that P. longiporus forms a terminal,
strongly supported clade, closely related to P. ciliatus. A description
and illustrations of the present species and a key to the species of
group Polyporellus are provided.
